definition.text: A data mine is a hierarchy that contains definitions of sensor and indicators bots, and their plotters. These definitions are consumed from the actual code of such bots.

translations.text: Un Data Mine es una jerarquía que contiene definiciones de sensor, bots indicadores, y sus trazadores. Estas definiciones se obtienen del código de dichos bots.
Шахта данных - это иерархия, содержащая определения датчиков и ботов-индикаторов, а также их плоттеров. Эти определения взяты из фактического кода таких ботов.

paragraphs.text: In a way, data mines are catalogs of bots that anyone may create. This hierarchy provides all the tools required to create sensors, indicators, and plotters, with minimal coding required.

Because the hierarchy provides definitions, it does not intervene in the execution of bots. Instead, the definitions in data mines are instantiated from the network hierarchy by bot instances. Bot instances and process instances are the ones running the code according to the definitions in the corresponding data mine.
codeName is the name of the data mine as used within the code of the system.
